intro: Cavendishia ulei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and horticultural displays.
